SENT.plain: The authors examined a 2-month-old infant with clinical signs of Pfeiffer's syndrome (craniosynostosis, abnormalities of the extremities, normal psychomotor development)
In the family other affected cases were revealed with a variable expressivity of the clinical signs
The authors draw attention to the importance of a detailed clinical, X-ray and anthropometric examination of different members of the family to detect carriership of the gene for ACS
